bill_title: authorize the assignment of health insurance proceeds to health care providers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the assignment of health insurance proceeds to health care providers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-17-61 be amended to read as follows: 58-17-61. Any person insured by a health insurance company, health maintenance organization, preferred provider organization, individual practice association , or nonprofit hospital service corporation may assign in writing benefits from such policy, contract , or certificate to a hospital licensed pursuant to chapter 34-12 or health care provider licensed pursuant to Title 36 . If such assignment is executed and written notice thereof is given, the insurance company, health maintenance organization, preferred provider organization, individual practice association , or nonprofit hospital service corporation shall pay the benefits directly to the hospital or health care provider licensed pursuant to Title 36 . Nothing in this section modifies the scope of coverage or the amount of benefits payable under a health insurance policy, contract , or certificate. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the assignment of health insurance proceeds to health care providers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-17-61 be amended to read as follows: 58-17-61. Any person insured by a health insurance company, health maintenance organization, preferred provider organization, individual practice association , or nonprofit hospital service corporation may assign in writing benefits from such policy, contract , or certificate to a hospital health care facility licensed pursuant to chapter 34-12 or health care provider whose practice is listed in § 58-17-54 . If such assignment is executed and written notice thereof is given, the insurance company, health maintenance organization, preferred provider organization, individual practice association , or nonprofit hospital service corporation shall pay the benefits directly to the hospital health care facility or health care provider whose practice is listed in § 58-17-54 . Nothing in this section modifies the scope of coverage or the amount of benefits payable under a health insurance policy, contract , or certificate. BILL HISTORY 1/18/00 First read in House and referred to Commerce. H.J. 117 1/25/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Commerce Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 1. H.J. 283
